Column Comment.0: MAPPING IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a mapping between systems.
Column Comment.1: MAPPING DETAIL OBSERVATION NUMBER: A unique number identifying eachindividual mapping for the systems.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: COLUMN NAME: Name of the column within a specific table found in the schema
Column Comment.4: COLUMN NAME: Name of the column within a specific table found in the schema
Column Comment.5: CREATE METHOD TYPE: The type of method that is used to create the value in thiscolumn. The method could include manual selection and key entry, automatedrandom generation, concatenation of values etc. If you wish, the code used togenerate the key value can be stored in PPDM COLUMN, and the last assigned keycan also be stored.
Column Comment.6: DEFAULT VALUE: Use this column to store the default value that will be createdduring a migration or data load. Store dates, numbers and text in this field, withappropriate conversions during the load. Note that a single column is used for alldatatypes to make creating loading scripts easier.
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.8: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data is no longer valid.
Column Comment.9: MAP DESCRIPTION: A narrative description of the mapping rule.
Column Comment.10: MAPPING OWNER BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: unique identifier for the businessassociate who owns this mapping between systems.
Column Comment.11: PPDM MAPPING TYPE: The type of mapping between two elements, such as datathat is simply migrated from one system to the other without any change, data that ismapped through a reference table, a mapping that requires some computation orcalculation or a multiple mapping where the source and target do not have a simpleone to one relationship.
Column Comment.12: MAP VERSION REFERENCE NUMBER: a number identifying the version of themapping between systems that this represents.
Column Comment.13: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.14: PREFERRED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this mapping is a preferredversion of the mapping.
Column Comment.15: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.16: RING SEQUENCE NUMBER: where relevant, you may indicate the order in whichthis mapping must be loaded in order to conform to the Load of the Rings policy.
Column Comment.17: SCHEMA ENTITY IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for an entity or object in an XML orEDI schema.
Column Comment.18: SCHEMA ENTITY IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for an entity or object in an XML orEDI schema.
Column Comment.19: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.20: SOFTWARE APPLICATION IDENTIFIER: The identifier for the application that ownsthis alias or code or that is used to apply the data in this row.
Column Comment.21: SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for a data storage system, such as adatabase or XML schema.
Column Comment.22: SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for a data storage system, such as adatabase or XML schema.
Column Comment.23: TABLE NAME: The name of the table within a schema.
Column Comment.24: PPDM TABLE NAME: the name of a table in a schema.
Column Comment.25: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.26: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.27: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.28: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.29: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.30: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.31: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
